abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the project is rated as
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. The Bank took a
            leading role in promoting essential sectoral adjustment, and
            was flexible on project restructuring. While the
            Borrower's performance is also rated satisfactory,
            corrective actions were slow to be implemented. The key
            lessons convey that, regarding the nature of the project,
            policy reforms and investments, were appropriate measures to
            achieve project objectives, which provided the suitable
            incentives for private development. This success was highly
            dependent upon the Government's commitment towards
            divestiture, although the aid suspension from the Caisse
            Centrale de Cooperation Economique (CCCE), affected the
            whole sector, conducive in part, to insufficient local
            budgets, since, adequate counterpart funding is critical for
            project implementation. Furthermore, the absence of
            effective project management, and accountability, also
            affected the extensive beef production component, both
            essential elements for a successful implementation. Although
            the Mid-term review was effective in enabling corrective
            actions, particularly in enhancing beneficiary
            participation, severe constraints, such as creditworthiness,
            and road accessibility, hindered both rural, and private
            development. Bush fires remain a complex issue, to be
            addressed on a multi-sectoral approach, outside the
            project's scope.

18156176.theme: Rural services and infrastructure,Rural markets,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization,Regulation and competition policy
18156176.trustfund: TF023975-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND - NEW,TF028001-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND,TF022065-LIVESTOCK SECTOR PROJECT
18156176.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The ultimate objective of the project is
            to increase livestock output in order to reverse a
            potentially alarming demand/supply situation, as well as to
            promote exports.  The project would consist of a package of
            policy and institutional reforms, supported by two
            components, one for institution building and one for
            production development.  The main policy reforms are :i)
            encouragement of farmers associations to take over
            responsibilities such as feed mixing and distribution,
            fodder seed multiplication, cattle breed improvement and
            milk collection; and ii) the incentive framework should
            allow market-based competition, requiring that suitable
            pricing mechanisms be established for dairy products
            imported under food aid or subsidized surpluses.  The
            institution strengthening component would promote private
            veterinary practice and review and reform formal training in
            livestock and veterinary science.  The production
            development component would include support to cattle
            production systems, mainly through improved disease control;
            dairy development in the central highlands by strengthening
            dairy producers associations and improving milk collection.
